title: 1st Signal Command (United States)
content:
The 1st Signal Command was a Signal Corps command of the United States Army, based at Fort Riley between 1967 and 1969.

The command was constituted on 19 April 1967 in the Regular Army as Headquarters and Headquarters Company, 1st Signal Command, and activated at Fort Riley on 25 April 1967. Based at Camp Funston, the command was subordinate to the headquarters of the 23rd Field Army Support Command.[1] It was inactivated in March 1969.[2]
